Author: Sebastian River
Title: Meh - least favorite Mario Kart
Body: Meh. Have owned and played all the Mario Karts. This is by far my least favorite. Skill is replaced by luck. I do like the different routes you can take, but it seems like a 5 year old cartoon vs a skilled race. It's ok I suppose, but after 1 hour I don't plan to play it again. Best strategy I saw was stay 2nd or 3rd until almost the end, or you will be hit with 3 different items at once going from 1st to 8th in last few feet. Happened too many times to be coincidence. The AI needs work as it continuously cheats your skill. Controls need a bit of work too. If you play, disable the auto steer which is confusing.

Author: specialk42day
Title: Best Mario Kart. Great for All!
Body: All Mario Kart games have always been a great game for friends and family of all ages. I had the Wii U version and already knew this is an amazing game. The fact that it has all the DLC included makes it an incredible deal. So many courses and if Nintendo made more DLC courses available for purchase I would buy them all in a heartbeat.The added steering assist option is great for kids and non-serious gamers. It helps them stay in the race and keeps then from feeling bad about their performance. Don't worry if you are a serious Mario Kart racer rest assure that the steering assist disable the purple drift boost and forces the kart to stay on the main path, which makes it hard to take advantage of shortcuts.My only very minor complaint is you cannot choose the battle mode to play; they cycle through the battle modes. Probably cause everyone only only play the balloon battle mode. My girlfriend and I only play the course races online now and that is more than enough fun.This is the best Mario Kart to date and should be in every Switch owners game library.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: ronnyek
Title: Mario Kart has always been one of my favorite series, but there is no possible way this ...
Body: Mario Kart has always been one of my favorite series, but there is no possible way this game is worth more than ~30 bucks. In an effort to I guess make people in last place and constantly gives them all the best items. If you get in first mostly just coins. Ruins the game, Not even an option to turn that off.Fam and kids played this for maybe 5 total days, and havent touched it since. Theres just not a ton of replay value, its real easy to get all tracks and powerups and track variation is meh.I havent played all mario kart games, but I feel like while the older games had worse graphics, they didnt have these weighted systems for item distribution. I'll be selling this game back.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: Transcendent Sacred Courage
Title: Hi, I'm Daisy!
Body: Yeah. I main as my girl Daisy. Since Mario Kart: Double Dash!Regardless, Mario Kart 8 Deluxe is the gem of all Mario Karts. From its graphics, elaborate levels and challenges, this game is great for those who play alone or with friends and family. Since I play alone, I have no judgment on the multiplayer aspect. However, my prediction is that it's nothing short of fantastic!All five modes are readily available: 50cc, 100cc, 150cc, Mirror Mode and 200cc. In some courses, especially on 150cc and 200cc, prepare for immense frustration, as the CPU will undoubtedly pummel you with an onslaught of items such as Red Shells, Green Shells, Blue Shells and Lightning. If you lose first place, it's very difficult trying to get it back; the CPU this time around are merciless. Unfortunately, for every console Mario Kart to date, I've always had to deal with the CPU's ruthless assaults. Especially if I'm in first place, which I usually keep. Advice: always try to have at least two items. One on the back of your kart and the other one for safe keeping.200cc is where the real challenge lies; not only must you be wary of your opponents and environment, but your driving skills should be nothing short of superb. Otherwise, it's off the track you go! Or at the very least you'll keep bumping into obstacles and going off road if your drifting and braking simultaneously is terrible.The soundtrack is very diverse and wonderful as well. I appreciate all of them, yet there are ones that are conspicuous more than others: Electrodrome, Rainbow Road, Bowser's Castle, Thwomp Ruins, Shy Guy Falls, Dolphin Shoals and Wild Woods. Beautiful compositions, as well as the overall environment.There are over a dozen characters to choose from. Some less original than others. I say that because those slots could have gone to other original characters that could have either made a first-time debut, or a return. Double Dash was the only Mario Kart where each character had a unique special. Unfortunately, these don't return in Mario Kart 8 Deluxe.Different vehicles are prominent, each with different stats that could make or break a race for you: Traction, Handling, Weight, Acceleration and Speed are all the stats. Find the right balance. Unlockable vehicles, tires and paragliders will become available the more coins you collect.Overall, I love this game. This is my favorite Mario Kart to date; Double Dash's throne is now overthrown, placing second. I intend to keep playing. Start racing with anti-gravity today!Daisy: You know I'll win! - Mario Party 7 - Gamecube Era.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: woofy
Title: Best Mario Kart Experience So Far
Body: I already own Mario Kart 8 for the Wii U, so I was hesitant on picking this up, especially since I already bought all the DLC, but new version is totally worth it. The deluxe version has enough new features for me to justify getting it:- The graphics on this new version blow the Wii U version away. It's so much more crisp and vibrant. The higher frame rate also makes it look so much more smooth.- In my opinion, this is the perfect kind of game for a handheld experience. It's the kind of game where you can just pick up and stop playing as soon as you need to. So this will be game of choice when I take my Switch with me when I travel.- Other cool new features: new characters, all of the DLC included, steering assist, online play. The first two reasons above were enough for me to like this version, though.

Author: J. Hallahan
Title: Excellent version, challenging and full of things to try
Body: While it is pretty much the same as the version that came out for the Wii U, it does have a few extra features.  While I had played the game on the WU, I never purchased the system or the game and therefore was excited to be able to play it on my own system.  This game is really fun to play at parties, especially since you can just pull out the kickstand on the Switch and not have to worry about plugging it in to the TV.  I also like how you can turn on different handicaps such as assisted turning and acceleration to help new players be able to participate.I also found this to be more smooth and overall better made than the regular Wii version. While I did love the Wii version and think that one's awesome as well, I love all the different modes, ways to customize your car, and different tweaks you can do for new challenges.  It seemed in the Wii version you pretty much found a character/kart setup and never used anything else ever again.Overall, I've already played it a ton and love the game. Nothing negative to say about it!
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: Jan
Title: Fast-paced and exciting
Body: Mario Kart 8 Deluxe is a fast-paced and enjoyable game that works well for all ages, and its portability on the Switch makes it an easy choice. Though admittedly the game is more fun with more people, single-player itself had a lot to offer, and I found myself surprised by the number of things to do for a completionist like me.First, there's the Grand Prix mode, which rewards players with a satisfying trophy every time they place in either the first, second, or third places, motivating success for all players. Giving separate trophies for different speeds, including 50, 100, 150, and the new 200 cc, makes everyone feel like a winner, even beginners to the franchise. I enjoyed how easy it was for people of all experience levels to pick up the game, as most of my friends who do not play video games were easily able to start driving (granted, they did turn on smart steering).Next, there's the Time Trials, where you can race with virtually anyone else in the globe with the game without having to have them physically be there. The addition of the Staff records gave an additional challenge for more experienced players willing to take on the challenge. Also, playing all of these races and collecting coins unlocked a series of kart customization options. Coming from a player whose last Mario Kart game was on the Wii, I loved picking out and testing new kart, wheel, and glider combinations each time I played, so even if I played the same stages over and over, it still felt new and exciting.On to multiplayer though, it's pretty great to bring Mario Kart around and be able to play with multiple people without having to stay confined to 20 feet of the TV or by yourself on a 3DS. Though the screen gets a bit small and it's a little harder to see when another person joins, it's worth it for the hours of fun the game can provide.Though I didn't usually play battles on Mario Kart Wii, this game gave so much variety rather than the usual balloon battles and coin runners (though they were included) by adding three new modes, my personal favorite being Renegade Roundup, solely for the thrill of either perpetually having a piranha on my kart or running away from them. I was a tiny bit disappointed over the number of battle stages, as I expected more.Overall, the game's a great buy and is perfect for long plane rides (I speak from experience), fun with friends, or even just a normal day at home. Whether a casual gamer or somewhat intense, Mario Kart 8 Deluxe brings the perfect balance between fun and competition.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: John T
Title: Cheap AI - unplayable
Body: I've been a Mario Kart purist going back to the original, and these just keep getting worse. This game is no longer about skill, at all. Anything higher than 50 cc the AI will absolutely destroy you when you're in first. There's literally nothing that you can do, just constant weapons hitting you and since you're in front you can't fight back, but it never fails that you'll get passed at the end of the final lap, even if you had the perfect race. It's also suspicious that none of the circuit races are timed.  It's almost as if Nintendo wanted to hide the fact that it's pointless to try and beat your best time, which was a big part of the original.  They know the AI is awful and completely ruins the competition and fun.  But why?  Makes no sense for the game to be this way.  I don't know how people get into this. Maybe as a drunk party game where no cares if they win or even finish a race, but if you're seriously playing to win races the AI makes it nearly impossible, and again it never shows you what your lap time is. Hopefully soon the Angry Video Game Nerd rips this pile of junk to pieces.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Title: One of the best video game series ever made.

Mario Kart is a great series to play when you just want to relax, and don't want to strain your brain with puzzles, or get frustrated with a really difficult game.Pros: Bright, colorful, cartoon like graphics.  Lots of different tracks.  Lots of characters to choose from.  Customizable vehicles.  Unlockable vehicles.  Different kinds of vehicles.  4 different racing speeds.  Single player, and online player.Cons:  The only cons I can think of is that it doesn't have all the tracks from all the Mario Kart games, and it doesn't have the two person vehicles of Mario Kart: Double Dash.Overall this is one of the best games ever made.

Author: Cameron
Title: Not as good as Wii U version
Body: Mario Kart 8 Deluxe is a switch port for the original Mario Kart 8 for the Wii U.I loved the original Wii U version. What's missing in the switch version is lack of new content. It's like the developers forgot to add these new battle modes and a few other characters because the new console just came out.There are 5 new characters, Squid Girl, Squid Boy, King Boo,  Bowser Jr, Dry Bones, and Gold Mario (which is just a skin of Metal Mario) but you have to unlock him by beating 200 CC with coming first at least in all cups.Doing this made the game very unenjoyable and then when I had Gold Mario I thought was all of that effort worth it? No it wasn't.Dry Bones, and Bowser Jr have been in Mario Kart games before so technically they shouldn't have been included as new characters for Deluxe.The inclusion of the Splatoon Inklings makes it seem like a pointless advertisement for Splatoon 2 rather than a well thought out exclusive Switch title.They had the best opportunity to make Mario Kart 9, which is what I would have preferred over this, but sadly they threw that opportunity out the window.If you already own the Wii U version and enjoyed that better, I suggest don't get the Switch version. It's pretty much the same with fewer differences. But you're still paying for full price which is highway robbery.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

The revamped battle modes are really cool, with tons of unique mixes of combative gameplay that totally make it worth it.I'm not usually a big graphics booster per se, but the sheen on this version of the game makes it quite alluring, really makes the track shine.Arguably the best racing game of all time, a must have for the Switch.

Author: Kate
Title: Best Mario Kart yet
Body: Having skipped the Wii U, I hadn't played Mario Kart since the version on the Wii. I got this the day it released and have been having a blast since. This is the best version yet. It's great having all of the characters and tracks unlocked from the outset. The item distribution remains infuriating especially if you're leading the race, but that's part of the Mario Kart charm, I suppose. The AI difficulty really ramps up at 150-200cc, and totally amplifies item rage when you're inevitably targeted by blue or red shells in the last lap of a race. Additionally, online play has been fun, but not without occasional connectivity issues. Although those have largely improved since launch.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: J. Sullivan
Title: Mario Kart 8 Deluxe is an Exhilarating Must Have Title
Body: I absolutely love Mario Kart 8 Deluxe. It has plenty of exciting tracks from which to choose. Several different vehicles, wheels, and airfoils unlock as coin collection quotas are achieved throughout the races.I was looking for a game with intense action, and MK8D delivers with a diverse cast of Nintendo characters who will pelt your cart with shells, slip you up on banana peels, cast Bloopers to blind all the racers with a temporary ink screen, and utilise a few more clever little tricks to test your patience.A huge selection of tracks, combined with the different racing classes, and a mirror track circuit, opens up a wide range of racing at different skill levels.I find that getting three stars on all of the tracks is simple in the 50cc class. I skipped the 100cc class, and I jumped straight into the 150cc racers, providing a decent challenge in which I am still taking my time trying to get all of my three-star victories. I still have a heart pounding 200cc class to tackle when I'm ready.I really wanted to enjoy competing online, but some days are better than others in regard to being able to maintain a connection to the server.With each update, the graphics have been given more detail, and gameplay has improved, although I still get bumped out of the online races on occasion.Local multiplayer is a blast, but I could not imagine being able to do well on a split screen unless docked to be viewed through a full size television. Single player handheld is totally doable, though.I mostly play the four race circuits, but there are other modes that look quite fun.I love the weapons system. Two items may be in possession at any given time, the most recently acquired of which remains in reserve until the first weapon is spent. The 8 is a rare treat, which equips your kart with all eight weapons at once, their symbols circling your kart, and can be used in any order when selected when straight in front of your racer.I love my Switch, and I think Mario Kart 8 Deluxe is a must have title with incredible replay value. It is wonderful to play on the go, and is an amazing game to knock a few races out at my convenience at home. It is fun, it looks spectacular, and shortcuts are scattered about, and can gain some distance if your risk is met with success.I highly recomm mario Kart 8 Deluxe! It is a masteriece of a game that is exciting for experienced gamers, and is equipped with helper options that can make kart racing more accessible to young players who may not be as good at staying on the road. I love everything about it, except for the inconsistent internet connectivity.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: Andy
Title: Mario Kart Nostalgia
Body: I haven't played Mario Kart since the N64, so this was a great leap back into it!  The racing is very nostalgic and seems that it was built for everyone in mind.  It was auto steer for those who may have young children that they still want to play with, I don't use it but it's a nice feature.  There are a lot of maps!  Each map is unique with great detail, the downhill slalom course is unique as there is no lap, but first one down the mountain.  The online features work quite well, a couple of hiccups here or there but overall very solid.  I highly recommend buying this if you own a switch as it is a very well built game and will provide hours of entertainment.  Just watch out for those blue shells :)
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: John
Title: Yikes
Body: There may not be a more unbalanced game that relys more heavily on luck than this it crazy! You can be really good and just get screwed over on the last lap! It makes this game soo frustrating! Now it's not bad to have a frustrating game look at souls games, but in those you know why you died! In this it's just luck. Games aren't fun if luck can beat skill cuz then what's the point of getting better at it! It just gets worse everytime I play! I thought driving games were about skill not who can get lucky enough to not get blue shelled, red shelled, and green shelled on the last lap while in first to end up taking like 6th! Nintendo peaked at the 64! Play Mario cart 64 and see how much more balanced and actually fun and not rage inducing it is!Edit:Boy was I mad when I wrote this. It's Mario Kart, it's great! I've played this more than any other Mario Kart. Sometimes a deep breath goes a long ways.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: Craig Deming
Title: The Switch treatment gives this great game the exposure it needs.
Body: MARIO KART 8 DELUXE: REVIEWNINTENDO’S LATEST RACER GETS A TUNE-UP ON THE SWITCH Consider, if you will… I know a game that is played by adults and kids, nerds and jocks, and everyone in between. It is thrilling, heartbreaking, and stands as one of the fiercest stress tests of your friendships in existence. It stands to many as the ultimate contest, the final say in conflict resolution, the great equalizer. Friends, I have never seen a game bring people together like Mario Kart. It is the only game I have played both at college parties AND with my wife’s family (even my mother-in-law. Her Wario is vicious.) It is the only game I have seen self-described “non-gamers” pick up and enjoy that doesn’t involve aggressive birds or pieces of candy being smashed. Nintendo’s arcade kart racer has been around for a while now, and it’s latest iteration, Mario Kart 8, was an incredibly smooth, colorful and simply addictive experience on the Wii U. There was really just one problem with it. Okay, maybe two.1) The game’s battle mode was treated as an afterthought, where battles were fought on actual tracks as opposed to arenas, as in previous games. It made it damn near impossible to even FIND other players, forget being able to peg them with items as you zoom in opposite directions.2) The game carried the burden of being released on the Wii U, a console that vastly undersold compared to Nintendo’s original projections. It was a great game that was released on a platform that couldn’t give it the exposure it needed. Today, however, Nintendo’s newest console has far outpaced not just its predecessor in the Wii U but is on track to outsell the Wii, one of Nintendo’s highest selling consoles in industry history. Due to the much wider exposure provided by this higher install base, Mario Kart 8 Deluxe will see a much bigger audience compared to the original title on the Wii U. So for many, this will be a brand new gaming experience. But the real test will be for those of us who already owned, played and enjoyed the original title on the Wii U. Is this “Deluxe” edition worth paying for a second time? The short answer is yes. The slightly longer answer is that Mario Kart 8 Deluxe is the definitive version of the long-standing franchise. And the full answer follows here: The concept of Mario Kart is relatively simple. You pick a character and a kart and race against Mario and his candy-colored acquaintances of the Mushroom Kingdom across wild tracks while hurling items of various destructive powers at each other. Controlling your kart is an easy affair, with gas and brake each getting a button, while one shoulder button launches items and the other allows you to drift around corners and jump off of ramps and environmental bumps to catch some air and earn a small boost. But in Deluxe, the ability to tailor your controls gets an upgrade. Say you’re playing with a small kid that doesn’t quite understand game controls, or a significant other or friend that is only playing for social reasons. There is an option to activate “steering assist” for their character. This feature keeps the player from driving off the edge of the track. The trade-off is that steering assist prevents you from purposefully leaving the main track to take advantage of a shortcut, encouraging players using it to learn to steer and work the turns without the assist.  This feature can be turned on and off both while customizing your kart and by pausing a race. But driving, drifting and boosting isn’t all to consider when playing. Littered along the tracks are coins, which will increase your top speed as you collect them, and glowing rainbow-colored boxes that contain valuable items. These items range from banana peels that you can drop behind you to cause an opponent’s kart to slip and spin out, turtle shells of various colors that act as kart-to-kart missiles, mushrooms that give your kart a turbo boost, and some especially destructive items that can affect all racers, or even just the racer in first place. Yes, the dreaded blue shell makes its return, but fortunately players have one more option to avoid the normally devastating item. In addition to using a mushroom boost at the right moment, a new item called the Super Horn can destroy a blue shell while it circles your head. Item balance in general seems far less chaotic this time around, as even in the higher difficulties I very rarely ran into a situation where I felt my good driving was punished by rubber-banding AI. Don’t get me wrong, you will still get blown up with a red shell, blue shell or a Bullet Bill when closing in on the finish line on the last lap. But it happens with far less frequency when playing alone, so earning those gold cups in Grand Prix mode is a far less frustrating task. Those playing alone have a surprising number of options at their disposal, including the aforementioned Grand Prix mode, a regular Vs mode where you can choose races and tracks while competing against AI opponents, Time Trials where you can aim to beat the fastest times on courses, and even battle mode is available to single player. Earning gold cups in the Grand Prix mode across various difficulty levels is the only way to unlock a couple secret goodies, so while all characters are available from the bat, the game still tries to incentivize you to tackle all challenge levels. Beating all levels is also a good way to collect lots of coins, which you will need to unlock many of the parts you can use to customize your kart. Most standard parts will be unlocked once you reach 3100 coins total, but there are some super-secret ones that you will either need to hoard coins or master other modes to obtain. Despite the strength of single player, getting some friends together on the couch is where Mario Kart truly begins to shine. The game allows up to 4 players to compete on a single system in either traditional races or battles. And up to 8 Switch consoles can connect wirelessly so everyone can play with their own screen. This is helpful as trying to play with more than two players while using the system’s tablet screen in tabletop mode can make it difficult for you to effectively track your position. One of the new highlights that especially comes alive with multiple players is the freshly revamped battle mode. Learning from the mistakes of the original version, battles once again take place in open arenas as opposed to race tracks, making it far easier to chase down opponents and make some lovely chaos. Modes from previous games, such as Balloon Battle, Bob-omb Blast and Shine Thief make their return, and are joined by a brand new battle type called “Renegade Roundup”, which is essentially a Mario-style game of cops and robbers that finds “the law” using Pirahna Plants on their karts to try and gobble up “renegades”, who are trying to dodge the law while freeing their trapped allies. Each mode provides a fun twist that can change up strategies from match to match. Online play is also available in MK8D, and while the game plays incredibly smoothly with little to no lag, the features online still feel a little barren. There is no in-game voice chat, meaning that friends playing together will have to find other means of communication. You can create a room for just your friends, but there is currently no means of sending said friends an invitation, once again necessitating an alternate form of communication in order to coordinate races or battles. You can organize your own tournaments as well…but again, getting people to join requires you get word out about what time it takes place around the net, although at least there is an option to browse current tournaments you can join. Hopefully, once Nintendo releases the full online suite for the Switch, it will provide an easier means of inviting friends to play online. Apart from the massive changes to battle mode and the increased local multiplayer ability, most of the changes to Mario Kart 8 Deluxe are a little more subtle. Players can now carry up to two items instead of just one, and it is possible to charge up a mini-turbo even further while drifting around corners. More apparent from the get –go is the roster of characters, which is completely unlocked from the beginning as opposed to unlocking drivers with gold cups like in the original title. All characters made available as DLC in the original title come packed right in right from the get go (in addition to all the additional tracks). On top of an already large roster of characters, series veterans Bowser Jr., Dry Bones and King Boo finally make their return to the kart championship. And joining them are two brand new characters, the Inklings from Splatoon. There’s even a Splatoon-themed arena in battle mode, based off of a stage from the first game.  The added benefit of being able to play the Switch on the go means that this game and its quick, 3-to-5 minute races make a perfect portable game as well. If all this feels like a lot to take in, that’s because this game is easily the most full featured Mario Kart in Nintendo’s history, and is easily the definitive version of the game up to this point. What The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild provides for a single player adventure, Mario Kart 8 Deluxe provides as well for the friends who just wanna flop on the couch, grab some controllers, and cause some chaos while testing the strength of their friendships. Mario Kart 8 Deluxe is a must-have for the Switch, and I heartily recommend its purchase as soon as you get the chance.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Title: Great Graphics, minor changes

There are new splatoon vehicles and new Battle Courses like coin runners where you can collect but steal others coins, the balloon battle includes more balloons, includes a bomb level, there is a map guide included at the lower right hand corner.  I'd say the major changes is within the battle mode as you have eight new levels only available in battle mode though, the battle options, but you also have new characters available and multiple attack weapon options for both battle and race mode. I recommend this game to anyone especially if you are a loyal fan of the Nintendo/Mario world.

Really good for younger kids as well since you can turn on helpers, like auto-go, can't-fall-off-the-track, and motion controls.  Highly recommend.  I hear the online has a few problems since it uses peer-to-peer (instead of dedicated servers), but I haven't noticed any issues myself.

Author: T. Azores
Title: Speaking as someone who's barely played video games at all, ever...
Body: ...Mario Kart 8 is my jam. :)I had my heart set on buying a Nintendo Switch, so I did that. And I decided that Mario Kart 8 would be my first video game. I wanted something cartoon-y and fun, not something deep, serious or profound. I have no experience at all with playing Zelda games, so I wasn't sure that'd be a wise choice for a first game. But Mario Kart? Come on. It's a racing game. You choose a character, you choose a vehicle, and you drive your heart out in those races, with the gorgeous racetracks. (My favorite is Rainbow Road.) Sure, there are pitfalls and traps, but it's still not hard to understand what you're supposed to be doing. It's an extremely easy game to pick up. And I think it's really easy to do well enough in the races to unlock vehicles, wheels or gliders.So I'm not the person to talk to about video games because like I said--I barely play them. I'm a casual gamer who likes mobile games like Diner Dash or tycoon games like Tap Tycoon. I don't consider those to be real video games. They're still games, sure, but I think those are the games you play to kill time when you're away from home. They aren't games that you actually set aside time for to play. So I don't consider myself a gamer, and I don't have a lot of experience with games for consoles like the Nintendo Switch. But I can tell you, Mario Kart 8 is a lot of fun. It's a great first game to play on the Switch. And I think this is an especially good choice if you don't play a lot of console games--because this game is meant to be easy to play, even if you're starting from zero with video games in general. It's easy to pick up and play--and then you'll learn the rest as you go along.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: Alan Andrews
Title: So fun!
Body: If you missed this on the Wii U, pick it up on the switch!  Even if you picked it up on the Wii U two things make this a must buy: local lan multiplayer and a true battle mode.  These two things make the repurchase a no brainer.  Add in the ability to go mobile, and yeah.  Every Sunday, we set up 4 Tv's and do 8 player local lan two people on a tv.  So fun!

Author: Chao Chao
Title: Great Party game!
Body: Great game in the Mario Kart series. This is a deluxe version of Mario Kart 8 that was released for the Wii U. This game has all the great things that make Mario Kart fun. The tracks are great and varied with some popular tracks from older Mario Kart games. Controlling the game works great too. You can use the Joy-Cons, split the Joy-Cons for 2 player, and use the pro controller. They all work great and controlling the kart is responsive and tight. They also include a Smart controller mode which basically helps steer and accelerate, great for younger kids. They will feel they are actually racing and not have to worry about falling off the track. There a lot of content in this game: tracks, racers, different kart mods, and the online play is fun too. This is a must have for the Nintendo Switch!
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: M. Kennedy
Title: Much improved from WiiU.
Body: Mario Kart 8 deluxe has the same racing courses as on the WiiU, but they made a few changes that greatly improved the game.BattleThis was the biggest, best change they made.  Instead of driving aimlessly through regular courses hoping you pass someone, they have created battle-specific courses, making battle more intense. There are 5 different modes in battle: balloon battle, coin runner, renegade roundup, ba-bomb blast, and shine thief. All are great. Our family favorite is Renegade Roundup.Beginner modeThey have added two new features that make this game more bearable while playing with small children. You can turn on your rc (at least that's what we call it. It gives you an antenna that makes your kart look like an RC car). This will make it so you cannot fall off the track. If you have this on, the game doesn't allows you to take some of the secret shortcuts.They also have an auto accelerator. This makes it so you do not have to push the gas the entire race.We were hesitant to buy this because it's basically the same as the WiiU version, but their improvements made it worth the money.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: Bernhard Wolf
Title: Best Mario Kart version ever
Body: Best Mario Kart version ever. The visuals are beautiful, and there are plenty of courses and abundant customization options. The only small drawbacks have been noted by other reviewers already;:It is too easy to turn on smart steering accidentially, and this mode is not much of a challenge even for novice players, it seems to be more for little kids, which is fine, but there should be some way to turn it off by default. Also, the instructions are lacking, and I had to go to youtube to figure out how to turn on motion control. I feel motion control should be the default given how the Switch controllers work (others might disagree), but a little instruction booklet included with the game might have made things easier.These are small gripes, the game is the most fun Mario Kart ever, therefore 5 stars.Oh, my biggest wish:Please, Nintendo: I would love Pikachu as a playable driver! Make a Pikachu Amiibo that can do that!!!
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: David T. Robinson
Title: Just like the great Mario Kart 8 but with Battle Mode and new characters
Body: Mario Kart. It's the best arcade racer ever created. I can't possibly add to what's already been said about Mario Kart 8 for the Wii U and this follow up, Mario Kart 8 Deluxe. What makes this version better isn't so much the new true Battle Mode or the new characters but how the game plays on the Switch platform itself.A friend of mine with a Switch console and Mario Kart 8 Deluxe took our systems to a company retreat held at an outdoor facility where a huge rainstorm left the field wet and muddy. We decided to use some free time to play some Mario Kart with our systems with wireless local multiplayer. Soon people began looking on as we played. We both detached the JoyCons on each of our consoles, which allowed one additional player per console to join in with the Switch units propped on a table top. Eventually this grew into a crowd and we opted to then use a docked Switch console to connect to a projector where we easily synced our pairs of JoyCons to allow four player multiplayer on this single console. This is where Nintendo's Switch console and games like Mario Kart 8 Deluxe shine. The flexibility of the console and simple fun of Mario Kart made for a very entertaining afternoon that was enjoyed by gamers and non-gamers alike.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: rodjoh
Title: Woohoo! Deja vu!
Body: Mario Kart 8 was a great game on the Wii U and it is still the best Mario Kart ever released.Mario Kart 8 Deluxe brings all the fun of the original version plus adds a few more features to it.The game looks as beautiful as ever, and runs smoothly. Perhaps even better than on Wii U due to the higher resolution supported by the new hardware.Now, and this is probably the thing I like the most about it, is that we finally have a console-quality Mario Kart game to play on the go. While all the portable Mario Kart games have been good enough, the console versions have always been superior by far. The fact that we can fit the entire Mario Kart 8 experience in our pockets now is a reality feels surreal.Mario Kart 8 Deluxe features all the tracks, characters, DLC and features from the orginal straight from the box. No unlocking... well actually scratch that, you do have to unlock the kart parts again. But all tracks and characters are ready to go from the start.If you never played MK8, you can expect a great arcade racing game with all the crazy combat action you can expect from the series. There's a few things you need to know.- Coins are back. Collect coins across the tracks to increase your max speed.- New items such as the Boomerang and the Pirahna Plant.- Antigrav mechanics, now you can ride your kart even on walls and upside down at certain sections.- As in Mario Kart 7, vehicles can be customized. You can glide through the air and drive underwater as well.- Mario Kart 8 for the first time in the series features cameo characters and tracks from other Nintendo games such as Zelda, Animal Crossing, Fzero, Excitebike and Splatoon.- Go all the way from 50cc up to 200cc for the first time. Yes, it is crazy fast and makes the game a lot harder than you'd expect.The Deluxe version brings a revamped Battle Mode that is actually fun to play, with the classic modes Coin Runners, Shine thieft, Balloon Battle, Bob Omb Blast and more. This definitely makes the experience feel more complete. It also brings back the ability to hold 2 items at the same time which hasn't been done since Gamecube's Mario Kart Double Dash.I don't know if the existance of this port means that Switch won't get its' own proper MK9. Hopefully it still does. Right now this is too much deja vu for my liking. But I do love MK8 and while I was ready for something new at this point, I'm just happy I can take this excellent gem wherever I go.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Title: Great pickup

Author: L.A.
Title: Mario Kart 8 was a great game on a weak console.
Body: If you have a Switch, there's no reason not to have this game. With the exception of items (blue shells, the bane of every Kart race), this game is as pure as Mario Kart gets.200cc is stupid hard but rewarding for longtime fans. There is a lot of options in terms of racers and kart options but I played this game for the Wii U, and they are have worn out on me (Link is cool, the Hyrule and F-zero tracks are awesome). There are also assist options for beginners which is nice since it lets them stay in the race but skill will always win.A great game and a great entry in the franchise. Now if we could get Super Smash Bros deluxe....
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Title: If you like Nintendo, you're going to love this!
Body: One of my specialties is playing Mario Kart. I've been playing most of my life, and this game already looked good even though I originally had it on the Wii U. It is still worth it, but that is what I think. Others might not. If you like, or even love Nintendo products, this is the game for you. If you're just now trying out games, still is a pretty good pick to buy. If you do not like the racing and competitive genres of games, then maybe do not buy this. Author: clinicalia
Title: Great game, but...
Body: Very fun and can make for some intense challenge for any player. My only issues are with online play. For one, the servers almost always seem to have trouble connecting, especially with international play. Secondly, it shouldn't be possible to use Smart Steering online. Third, I feel like there are too many items in online play somehow! It becomes less about racing with skill and more about... mowing people down with an insane amount of items. Every five seconds, I'm hit with something. I dunno, I feel like I have a legitimate argument there. Shoot, there were times where I was hit with a blue turtle shell, and I wasn't even in first place.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: Elvin
Title: A classic must have on every nintendo system!
Body: The grand prix maps are exactly the same?! Was expecting more in that area. There are new carts, wheels, and gliders however, as well as characters. The reason this gets 4 stars is the battle modes! They are hilarious, especially when playing with friends. I think a fair price would've been $30-40 but they are slow to release games on the switch right now and I've been playing Mario kart since the n64. The HD graphics are fantastic and the portability is amazing. I have to use the pro controller the small ones are hard with my big hands. The COMs seem to be smarter and more difficult vs the Wii U version. It was a fun challenge and always a hoot to rewind the highlight reel and see how you dropped from 1st to 8th on the last lap 5 seconds away from the finish line lol

Author: Drew Hines
Title: Just enough changes, to buy again
Body: So, you all may be thinking, What's the difference between this version and the Wii U version? Well, let me tell you. You may be a bit disappointed to hear that it's basically the same. The NEW additions are:-the Battle Mode (this was revamped, adding new modes and new stages),-Inkling Boy/Girl,-some Splatoon kart customizations,-Boo item,-Feather item (only available in battle mode),-Smart Steering OPTION (helps with not falling off the stage),-auto-accelerate OPTION (let's your kart move, without holding the gas button. GREAT FOR YOUNG players),-online mode was changed a bit.Also, the previous DLC packs for Wii U version, are included. With that being said, I think there's just enough that was added, to buy again if you were a MK8 U owner. If you never got your hands on the Wii U version, this is absolutely a MUST-BUY. This is a great party game, and is great for all kinds of ages! Nintendo hit a home run.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: TMSjokeman
Title: Fast Fun for All Ages
Body: Love it! The five stars almost don't feel like enough. Everything about this game is fun, and the challenges keep coming with new moods exclusive to the Nintendo Switch!If you have ever played MarioKart before, this is more of the same - fast, fun, and never-ending excitement. I don't think your the person I need to sell on this.If you have never played Mario Kart, and you have a Nintendo Switch...I mean, what are you waiting for??? Mario Kart 8 Deluxe is not just another racing game - you race underwater, through the skies, upside down, through a toybox; there is so much to see and do and learn here. Plus, there is a learning curve, and the game is designed to help you become a better racer gradually, while still letting you take home the Gold cup. Single player is great, and playing this on the go with the Switch is ideal because each race is never longer than 5 minutes total. You could easily power it up in the doctor's waiting room and probably finish a few Cups before being called back.And the multiplayer is great! There are other features designed to help even the odds between veterans and new-comers. From the Grand Prix to the Battles, it's anyone's game to win! The online is much more challenging, but after completing all the 150cc cups with Gold, you should be set to take anyone on.If you have a Nintendo Switch and don't have Mario Kart 8, you should question why you bought it in the first place.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Body: I own the WiiU version and can't tell you how much I've played it. This version is better in every way. The much improved battle mode is an absolute blast and the gameplay tweaks like double items, and a few new items, make the game play better. Author: CAL
Title: A Must Buy for any Switch Owner!!!
Body: Literally one of the best, if not, the best Mario Kart there is, another fantastic game in the Switch library. Better than the Wii U, and I played the original for countless of hours, this one is no exception. Online is fantastic as always, and playing with a friend or sibling is seamless. Most importantly, because the Switch is portable, you can play anywhere you go. I played with my brother once when we were waiting for food served at a restaurant, and because we could separate the joy-cons themselves as singles and with a strap, we played it and couldn't be happier. It's simple, on to the point, and most of all, just having a good time with it. For anyone who has a switch and kids, for couples, or have siblings, this one is a go-getter. Would recommend this to anyone.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: Chusko
Title: Best Mario Kart ever
Body: Mario Kart 8 Deluxe is a game that lights up a fire you may not have even realized was fading. This game is absolutely incredible. It takes Mario Kart 8, an already absolutely fantastic game, then improves upon it by offering the battle arenas and experiences we adored in previous Mario Kart games, the ability to play it anywhere in any way, and the wonderful graphics and sounds make this the complete package for single and multiplayer family fun. Everything has been tightened, fine tuned and better than ever. Mario Kart 8 Deluxe isn’t just here to help you through the first months of Switch's life, it is a game that will offer comfortable cruising for years to come.Pros ->-Portable 720p 60fps, Docked 1080p 60 fps-New Battle mode and Wii U DLC included-Smart steering for young kids and other extra items, though minor, are also welcomeCons -> If you already own the Wii U version it only brings a dramatic improvement in the graphics.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: Chimpster
Title: A must own game for Switch owners!
Body: Mario Kart 8 Deluxe is the definitive version of the game for the Nintendo Switch. It's fun to play both alone and with friends.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: Brett
Title: Is... is that a blue shell????
Body: Very fun classic mario kart.But.It's too much of a giver!I didn't really feel like I had any progression in the game!When you get the game all the levels, stages, and characters are unlocked already (save for the amiibo dlc). The only thing you can really unlock is kart customizations which, if you're any sort of decent at mario kart, hardly matter much besides their looks.Graphics are incredible, and there are a bunch of little details Nintendo added in that give this game the classic Nintendo feel with a bit of modernization.The racing mechanics are fun and easy to master with a little practice, as long as you shut off the drive-assist which is enabled by default (why?).Definitely brought back some good nostalgia, and I'm sure I'll play it... sometimes.I love Nintendo- die-hard fan- but man, please give us something new!There's very little replayability to the game. After beating each stage on 50, 100, and 150cc all I wanna do is scream what's new?The addition of link to the game was a welcome surprise and the hyrule themed map made me smile ear to ear. Please keep the switch alive with more great games, Nintendo!!
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: Micah
Title: Iterates, rather than innovates.
Body: Solid racer. This is packed to the brim with content, and absolutely anyone with a Switch should own this, as it is the best multiplayer game on the system currently. It doesn't get a perfect 5 stars from me simply because the game doesn't innovate from past titles very much. Still, if you like Mario Kart, you will definitely feel at home with Marko Kart 8.

Author: Alex
Title: SO. MUCH. FUN.
Body: I had never owned a Nintendo home console in my life, with the Switch being my first, but I had always been fond of all things Nintendo. I am so glad that Mario Kart 8 Deluxe came out soon after the Switch release because it really allowed me to embrace my life-long love for Mario games. This game IS SO MUCH FUN! My partner and I spent the entire release weekend racing and trying out all the courses. The graphics are beautiful, both on my TV and the actual Switch. Game controls are awesome and the new characters are definitely a fun addition (I'm always King Boo). Definitely recommend as a staple for any Switch owner.

Author: Martwal
Title: Great for Adults and Children!
Body: Have been enjoying Mario Kart since I first played it on the N64 back in the late 90's. I did not own a WiiU for varying reasons, therefore could not own Mario Kart 8. One of the most enticing parts about purchasing this game is that is already comes with some new content, as well as the DLC from the WiiU version of Mario Kart 8. This is a great game to enjoy by yourself, with friends, with family, and will definitely keep children busy. The Joy-Cons that come with the switch act as two controllers, so you are already guaranteed to be able to have two people enjoy this game at the same time. I would recommend also investing in a Pro-Controller or second pair of Joy-Cons if you find playing the game with just one Joy Con difficult. Overall the game's graphics are nice, keeping that cartoon feel Nintendo has done so well with for so long.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: Sliph
Title: Warning- Fan boy writing a review- I love nintendo. I love mario cart also
Body: Warning- Fan boy writing a review-I love nintendo. I love mario cart also. I have played all of them. This one was exactly what I expected. I try not to hype myself up for unrealistic things like them making a new game when they have many reviews and have stated exactly what you get with this game. This game is the same as the nintendo WII mario cart with added bonuses, like they added new maps, New Amiibos, New commands, and some other little things. I loved the mario cart on my WII U so I got this one knowing I would also love this one. However, I will give fair cons on this review so people will be not caught off guard. The online mode has issues, the network does go down and I have a very good internet provider. They have also warned people if you want to continue to play online they will be adding a SUB fee in the future. We have no idea how much that will be for. For now though I really like this game, If you can look past those cons and enjoyed the WII U version of this game you should be happy with the switch version as well. GL HF!
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Title: Mario Kart at it's finest
Body: Best Mario Kart I've played. Right off the bat the game comes with tons of maps and characters. It was kind of a bummer than you can only unlock one more character (gold metal Mario for winning all the 200cc courses) and the 200cc speed will take some getting used to but other than that no complaints. Author: Kim
Title: Its the Mario kart you love, all polished up
Body: This is the same song and dance you remember with Mario Kart 8. This time around there is no add on buys to get all the tracks and characters, its all bundled in. This is a nice touch if you never bought the add on packs to begin with. The graphics and play are all the same, but with an added battle mode. I DO wish there was more tracks in battle mode, but this is a small complaint.All in all this is a good game to have, if you love Mario kart racing, and if you never got it the first time around (which was me). If you already have it on WiiU and don't play all that much anymore, there isn't enough new content to really warrant the full pricetag.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: Bram DR
Title: The best multiplayer fun on Nintendo Switch so far!
Body: This Nintendo Switch version of the Wii U bestseller is best described as the 'definitive' version. All of the previous DLC, and more, was added to make this the best Mario Kart to date. The game has hours of singleplayer fun, especially considering the 200cc cups will take you a while. You can play online with up to 2 players in split screen or 4 players locally, which makes this the perfect multiplayer game on the Nintendo Switch! I would greatly recommend this game if you've already picked up Zelda and beat it, or if you're just looking for a fun pick-up-and-play fix on the Switch.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: DaftPunkie
Title: Fun for everyone
Body: This by far is the best in the series in my opinion. This version is exactly the same as the wii-u version but with all the additions and dlc included. Lots of little additions added and the UI seems more streamlined. My online experience has been perfect also. Only one disconnect that seemed to stem from issues with my own Wi-Fi router. My wife also has this game and both of us are able to play with each other on our respective Switches anywhere in the house flawlessly. The game runs very smooth and with no graphical bugs or noticeable lag nor frame rate drops. Plays amazingly in both docked and handheld mode.On a side note, my copy did not arrive on time and customer service helped ensure it arrived timely thereafter.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: Kobi-wan Cannoli
Title: Great game
Body: Lot of fun to play solo and with friends. Brought my Switch to a party and pulled this out when things got a bit quiet. We played for hours until the Switch had to be charged and helped relieve the awkwardness until dinner. The only thing keeping me from absolutely loving this game is the online play is a bit laggy. Sometimes we get hit by things we can't see or connection errors come up and we all have to remake the instance for someone to reconnect. As to be expected with the first couple weeks of launch but it is a bit frustrating. Especially when the A communication error has occurred pops up and we all get disconnected from each other. A good ol' hard reboot on our Switch devices usually fixes this for a few days though, so maybe an issue with the Switch?I will note, not sure if it was due to shipping or if it was damaged prior but the case has a thumb-sized hole at the top. Not that it really mattered for me, I put all my games in a carrying case and recycle the stock boxes.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Given the online service hasn't been tested a lot I've been very impressed with it. While I've had some disconnects from lobbies, I believe that likely has more to do with others in the lobby or our own slow (5mb/s) internet connection, with my fiance usually in another room streaming videos.

Author: Scott
Title: Great Game, But Still Has Online Connection Issues
Body: Wii U owners might remember that the original Mario Kart 8 was released for that home console back in 2014. Three years later, and we now have Mario Kart Deluxe, a way for Nintendo to capitalize on their huge Mario Kart fan-base without dedicating too much time and money into producing the 9th iteration of the franchise this early into the Nintendo Switch's lifespan. For the most part, Deluxe is identical to the original MK8, with a couple new features included to give players a reason to pay full price again for what is essentially the same game. These include additional Battle Modes, some new tracks, characters and vehicles, all the DLC from the original Wii U version, and some refinements to online multiplayer (such as being able to change vehicles and characters without leaving the online multiplayer lobby). Of course, the main draw to getting Deluxe is being able to play Mario Kart 8 on a handheld device, which for all intents and purposes has now eliminated the reason for players to still be using Mario Kart 7 for the 3DS. However, the real question is if all these minor enhancements are enough to make MK8 players spend full price again on what is essentially the same game. The answer to that is two-fold. For people who still own a Wii U system and the original Mario Kart 8, I would not recommend getting Deluxe. However, if you're planning on selling your Wii U and upgrading to the Nintendo Switch, or you never bought a Wii U in the first place, then yes, I would recommend getting Deluxe, as it will probably be several more years before we see a true Mario Kart 9 sequel.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: Kyle D.
Title: Childhood Fun!
Body: I remember first playing Mario Kart back shortly after the launch of the Super Nintendo. I was hooked from day one. I'd rush home after school to play against my friends, my sibling, and even my parents. As time went on my friends and I got older and moved on to play late night 4 player battle modes on the N64. Even more time went on and all of a sudden we found ourselves too busy in adulthood to dork out like we did as kids.Now in my early 30s, I knew I wanted a Switch from the moment it was announced. I knew, deep down, that it would deliver on the key franchises that I loved so much growing up.I'm happy to report that Mario Kart 8 Deluxe ABSOLUTELY delivers. From the gorgeous and smooth graphics to the wonky sound effects and quick styled gameplay - it's a TON of fun. Like Zelda, it's a blast to my childhood past, and that's something I cannot put a price on. Well played Nintendo. 10 out of 10 stars!
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: KfX
Title: Good racing game for KIDS
Body: Continues the MarioKart series very well. It has good graphics and lots of characters and cosmetic options to choose from to dress up your vehicle. Still, gameplay seems very youth oriented, like Lego and Disney Infinity games are. The cosmetic options don't give added powers or abilities, like speed or durability, its for appearances only. This game is definitely one for young kids rather than adult gamers, unless you're a diehard Mario Kart fan.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: Beta Sprite
Title: The best Mario Kart yet
Body: A very good port/update of Mario Kart 8 and all of its DLC.  Looks great in 1080p, and the new auto-accelerate option saves my right thumb from some pain.  The new guidance option also makes it possible for my daughters (2 and 5) to play alongside me, and they have a lot of fun being able to race and throw items around without falling off the track all of the time.In addition, since the Switch's JoyCon use joysticks instead of d-pads, I can stop using motion controls for steering across the board, which I had to pick up for Mario Kart Wii and Mario Kart 8, due to the controller types that I had available.  This is just a preference, though, as the motion controls are reliable for this game, as well.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: Daisy
Title: Slight Changes
Body: I'm a huge fan of Mario Kart.  My kids and I have played the different versions of it for years.  I think that's why we were not AMAZED when we played this version for the Switch.  The game looks and feels exactly the same as the Wii U version.  There are some tweaked changes to it.  New Characters such as Bowser Jr., Dry Bones, Gold Mario, Inkling Boy, Inkling Girl, and King Boo.  We never really used the battle mode but there are some new tracks for that mode.  They have some new vehicles as well.  The online mode has tournaments and you can add friends on your Switch  from the people you recently played with.  Regular Prix mode has a 200cc option now.  I like the ability to split the Joy Con remote with a second player.I highly enjoy Mario Kart and I really hope my thoughts on the Deluxe version change over time.  Hopefully with the ability to add new DLC on the switch we may see new tracks.  I really feel that is what this version is missing.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: Mindcrime
Title: Enough changes to make it an upgrade from Mario Kart 8 on Wii U
Body: Great game for families and for individual gamers.  We have Mario Kart 8 for the Wii U and I always enjoyed playing the game.  When it was time to pick up a Switch this was the game I was looking forward to.  I am not disappointed in this game even though it is not a completely new game.  There is enough changes and new things that make this game feel very fresh and a worthy addition to Mario Kart series.  I like this game for my son as it is non-violent and loads of fun to play together or online.  He is old enough where he can play your typical teenage Xbox game that has violence etc, but it is nice to see him play this type of game more than those.  For parents with younger kids, this is a great game to play as a family.  The graphics are good and the gameplay is fun.

Author: C. Taylor
Title: Great classic game back and better than ever with modern updates!
Body: Pre-ordered from Amazon for the Switch, and it's our favorite game, so far. Not going to lie, MARIO nostalgia runs big in this family, and even the next generation is already a big MARIO fan. All the great aspects of the classic MARIO Kart games have been preserved. The battles, the races, the ability to edge out your opponents with banana peels, turtle shells or a good old fashioned side swipe. There are tons of classic Nintendo characters to chose from, as well as courses from other Nintendo franchises. Let's just say Link for Zelda is a favorite for one of the kids. As parents, we enjoy battling each other in some good, healthy competition. Oh, I should mention the graphics look great on our tv, too!My only complaint is more to do with the game system than the game. Initially we played the game with a pro controller and the joy con L/R controllers locked into its base to make it work like a pro. The left joy con kept shorting out like it was having an interference problem. We had to ditch the pro controller and each use one of the tiny Joy Cons (I used the left and husband used the right). It fixed the issue, but they are so tiny they aren't as fun to hold like that. However, I have noticed the L joy com joy stick act a little funny with other games, so I'm not docking a star as it may be more of a Switch issue. I have read about other Switch owners having a similar problem. My advice - if you can afford the pro controllers at the hefty $69.99 a piece price tag, buy two of those to play this game.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: Dudley
Title: BEST MARIO KART, IF NOT GAME, EVER!
Body: Sorry for the all caps, I just love this game. I had always wanted Mario Kart 8, but sadly I never owned a Wii U.There is a very wide variety of tracks, being 48 in total (32 from the original game and 12 from the dlc). All the tracks are creative and have their perks, as with any Mario Kart game.BATTLE MODE IS BACK! There was a battle mode on Mario Kart 8, but it was famous for being lazy (It used race tracks from the game and only had balloon battles). This is all fixed in Deluxe, with eight dedicated battle courses and five battle modes, all of which are amazing.There are new/returning characters such as Bowser Jr., King Boo, and INKLINGS! Still no Birdo or Diddy Kong, though.The graphics are updated to 1080p and 60fps docked, from 720p and an odd 59fps on the Wii U.There are very few flaws, those being small things such as the coin item being too prominent or Pink Gold Peach being a character.This is the highest reviewed Mario Kart game to date, with the highest first day attach rate. It broke the first day sales record of Mario Kart Wii. This game is AMAZING!I didn't even mention double items! They are a game changer!It is very accessible for new players with options such as smart steering and auto acceleration. The only problem is that they are very easy to toggle on, so be careful.I would definitely recommend. 10/10!
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: Lynn Ledger
Title: A Fun Racer! If You Love Mario Kart, This is for You!
Body: I'm so happy to be playing Mario Kart again!  This was my game when I was younger, and having it now just brings it all back!  All of the tracks are gorgeous and fun to play.  There's enough of them with enough variety where everyone will find favorites.  The wide roster of characters to select from add to the fun!  I never expected to be playing Link in Mario Kart ever, and had a blast as him!  I've already dabbled in the battle modes, and those seem just as entertaining as I remember!  It sounds like the WiiU's version was lacking in this department, so I'm glad they made the improvements.  It's nice having the option to bank up 2 special toys to use on your competition from the mystery boxes, and I find it fun unlocking customization for my Karts.Its an exceptional game that I'm glad got a port to the Switch from the WiiU.  It is an older game though, so some who already HAVE it from the WiiU days may be a bit disappointed in not getting much fresh and new with this installment.  I'd give it a 4.5 Stars if I could simply because it is an older game that people have already on a different system.  I'd like to encourage Nintendo to have Switch era games available/developed like in the case of Zelda Breath of the Wild, so I believe a mild dock of stars would be appropriate.  Can't wait to play the next generation of Nintendo!
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: Adriana
Title: Excellent game
Body: I grew up playing Mario Kart on the N64 and this game is so much fun so far. I am loving how many tracks there are to race and all of the different car features there are to unlock. Can't wait to play more.

Author: Ryan
Title: Kingdom Karts III
Body: If you played Mario Kart 8 for Wii U, then you know that this is the best racing game on the series. With brilliant graphics, endless kart customizations, and numerous old and new courses to choose from, this is a no-brainer for the Switch. Since it is the Deluxe version, all of the DLC characters and cups are included leaving you only with kart customizations to unlock. That is very generous and makes it easy to just turn on and play from the get go. The new and old Battle modes were missing from the Wii U version and definitely bring new excitement to the multiplayer experience. I would comment on the Switch to Switch LAN type plan, but I don't know anyone else with a Switch. Regardless, this is a must have multiplayer game for your console.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: azog
Title: Second time purchase but no complaints
Body: I have MK8 on my Wii U so this is a re-purchase but I don't mind. I never unlocked much on the Wii U and didn't buy any DLC, and for various reasons, I didn't even enjoy playing MK8 on the Wii U. So even tho I purchased the same game twice, I have no regrets. I've only played single player mode, which is pretty boring (I always get 1st place). Online play is where it's at, even tho I am consistently in 12th place and losing points, it's still fun. I understand that Nintendo plans to make their online gaming a subscription based model before the end of 2017, so we'll see if I'm singing the same tune then.Tried it with various controllers: a bare naked Joy-Con, a Joy-Con in one of those steering wheels, the Joy-Con comfort grip, and the Pro controller. As expected, the Pro controller is the most comfortable and best way to play. If/when I play local multiplayer, I guess i'll have to use one of the Joy-Cons.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: Clare
Title: Best Mario Kart Yet
Body: Mario Kart 8 Deluxe is some of the best fun I've had in a while. I myself had skipped the Wii U entirely, but I had played the Wii U version at friends' houses. This is the definitive version of Mario Kart with a great mixture of new tracks and remastered old ones. And the added bonus of all the DLC tracks is pretty sweet too.Graphics: 5/5 This game runs at 60fps on and off the TV and at 1080p on the TV and 720p on the screen. For comparison, the Wii U version maxed out at 720p.Gameplay: 5/5 The different ways to race (antigravity, glider, and underwater) make this game both fun and difficult at some times.Battle Mode: 5/5 If you are a Wii U owner this is probably why you would purchase this game. There are several new battle modes (Renegade Roundup, Bomb Blast, Shine Theif) that give you something else to play besides the usual coin runners and balloon battle.Controls: 4/5 Some control schemes are better than others, but all of them are solid options. When I'm playing single player I like to use the joycon grip because the L and R buttons are bigger than when using the SL and SR on a single joycon.Music: 5/5 All of the tracks sound great and I love the emphasis on saxophone (I'm a sax player myself). On the DLC tracks like Zelda and Animal Crossing it's cute to see how they revamped the classic tunes for racing. And on the Cloudtop Cruise course you can even hear some hints of Super Mario Galaxy's Gusty Garden theme.Overall this is a great game and a must have for the switch, especially if you've never owned the Wii U version.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: J. Giles
Title: Game is near perfect... delivery from amazon a day late (which for a gamer on release day is big).
Body: This is the same Mario Kart that was on WiiU with the added luxury of all DLC and all characters (with the addition of a couple more) and the new battle mode.  It's an awesome package that is well worth the price of admission if you own a Switch (actually, it's a must have).  I really can say nothing bad about the game.  It's Mario Kart, and I feel it's the best MK to this day.  Love it.On the downside, I did order this Prime, and thought I'd have it the day it was released, but no. I received this the day after it was released.  Kind of a bummer when you go into a store and it's sitting on the shelf and you realize that yours is still on a truck somewhere between my house and some place in California.  It's not a huge deal, but when you read that if you preorder that you'll get it the day of release, and then you don't, it's kind of a let down and you start to think differently when maybe preordering from them again.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: Andrew
Title: Finally, a Mario game for the Switch
Body: This is a must-have for the Switch. The graphics are amazing, there are a lot of tracks, you can hold 2 items again, and it has all the features you would expect of a modern day Mario Kart. Overall... it's an ok game. Random non-Mario characters being in it, needing to collect coins, and gliding/underwater/zero gravity wall-driving all take away from the fun of racing. I personally also think that items are too big of a factor in winning (although it's not nearly as bad as the Wii Mario Kart was in this aspect).I'm actually quite disappointed in this game so far, but I'm sure it'll be much more fun once I can play with friends. When it comes down to it, I'm just really desperate for games on my Switch.

Author: Erik Christiansen
Title: BE WARNED: You can NOT play 8 player with 2 Switches.
Body: BE WARNED: You can NOT play 8 player with 2 Switches. For 8 player you need 4 Switches. On top of that, the Switches need to be within 3 feet of each other or you will drop connection before you even begin a race. To avoid the wireless you need to buy a LAN adapter for each Switch and connect them all to a router with internet. That's right you need a internet connection to play over LAN.Battle mode is amazing. The 4 players at 60 FPS is great. There are no new race courses, but 8 battle maps.

Author: Scooter
Title: Multiplayer heaven
Body: While I already played this game to death on the Wii U, having it in portable format is an amazing experience. Nintendo took the perfect Mario Kart game and added a great battle mode to it. This is as close to perfection a Mario Kart game can get. I do wish that Nintendo made it more affordable to play across multiple Switches without each child having to own their own copy of the game.  It doesn't make sense for families to own multiple copies of the same game. On the 3DS, you could do this so this seems like a major step back especially given that a big selling point of the Switch is playing together.

Author: Alphalpha
Title: One of the Best Contemporary Games, PERIOD!
Body: Amazing game. I will say it. Better than Zelda: Breath of the Wild for one reason: REPLAY-ABILITY! Long after we've all conquered TLZ:BOTW, Mario Kart 8 will still be worth playing. BOTW will be played only for nostalgia, that is, unless DLC starts pouring in. But I do not foresee such excess from Nintendo. Mario Kart 8 is just fun. Its addicting, it exciting, and it will have you shouting and jumping out of your seat with friends and alone. It's what gaming is all about. And it is this type of colorful, playful fun that makes Nintendo the best gaming company in history.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: Jergingha
Title: Bought it on Wii U three years ago, absolutely worth the double dip
Body: I was already sold when the port was announced. I wasn't going to keep playing the Wii U for long, and the online community would probably go down. So I pre-ordered this game as soon as I was able to, and after playing it for a few hours, it's the same great experience I enjoyed on Wii U, but if you can believe it, they somehow made it even better. First off, I'm actually surprised at how clean and crisp this game looks. I do not remember the Wii U version POPPING out of my screen like the Switch version does. It could be my 4K TV, idk, but man. The game is gorgeous and smooth. Gameplay is the same, which is great, but as I was racing and drifting, I noticed my Sparks turn purple.They added another GOT DANG DRIFT BOOST I'M SWEATIN, NOOBS BE WARNED WHEN I HOP ONLINE AND PREPARE TO GET CREAMED.I had no idea beforehand that they were doing that. I was excited. Little things like that, alongside the inclusion of more characters, a proper battle mode, and more make this purchase worth it. If you got the funds I say it's a no brainer, but otherwise I definitely recommend picking this up if/when it drops in price.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: Michael
Title: awesome game. better in multiplayer
Body: This is by far the best mario kart i have played yet. There is still the issue of destroy the person in first place with blue and red shells but i suppose it wouldnt be mario kart without it.i like how the drivers are unlocked up front, i can use the gray colored yoshi or the gray colored shy guy right away.excellent game. i pre-ordered this in january, when i pre-ordered my switch since i knew i would want it

Author: Kevin Malarkey
Title: First Mario Kart I've purchased since Mario Kart 64 and it's so sweet. Now please give us Mario Party next

Author: Mariofan105
Title: King of The Road!
Body: Mario Kart 8 Deluxe is the most visually impressive Mario game of all time, has the most content of any Mario Kart game, but does that make it the best?Pros:- Massive roster of characters!- 48 tracks!- Beautiful graphics (out does the Wii U)- Stats menu is much better done- You can hold 2 items again (this is a major game changer in a great way)- Boo item and feather return- Menu looks better- Controls are simple- Many different control options- You can play 2 player as long as you own the Switch since the Switch comes with a pair of Joy-Con controllers- Battle Mode is back and better than ever!- Nice variety of Battle Mode battles- Music is wonderful- Online seems to work greatCons:- Smart steering is annoying to keep turned off, very easy to turn it on by mistake- Still no proper trophy celebration- All characters and tracks are unlocked from the start of the game except for 1 characterAs you can see the pros really out weigh the cons by a lot! I was not a big fan of Mario Kart 8 on Wii U (I wrote a review here on Amazon), but I can safely say that every major flaw that game had has been fixed perfectly with this game! And I failed to mention one of the biggest pros and that is the fact that you can play this game anywhere! The Nintendo Switch allows you to take it with you and play this game wherever you want, and you will always have 2 controllers with you in case you want to play with a friend.The Nintendo Switch is a safe buy for any gamer, we already have Legend of Zelda Breath of the Wild and now we have possibly the greatest Mario Kart game ever made! Not to mention the impressive lineup of games we know that are coming for the Switch later this year. I'll end this review now, as Bowser and I have some races to win! See you on the race track fellow Nintendo fans!
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Boring, arrived several days late
Body: Not very fun. It's my first Mario Kart game. I thought I would get to customize the cart to upgrade the speed/abilities of your preferred cart, but it's all cosmetic with minor tweaks to stats. Maybe this is a good game for people with a lot of friends or something but single player is really boring. Not a game worth the full retail price. Also I pre-ordered it from Amazon and it arrived several days late. I wish I had not bought the Switch until more games came out.Game is very repetitious. Customizing the karts do almost nothing to their abilities, it's all just about how it looks. All players are unlocked already so there is nothing really to accomplish in the game unless you want to get some tires or something.You can only collect 10 coins at a time in the race to unlock the cosmetics, which is silly.My idea of a fun racing game was Star Wars Episode 1 Podracer. You could pick different engines and bodies for interesting combinations. Like you could pick a body that was tougher but slower, engines that were faster but made your racer harder to control etc. In this case, this is basically a little kid party game or something where nothing you do matters.
Styles: Platform For Display: Nintendo Switch | Edition: Standard
